Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: I made a transaction yesterday and if I check my address the kmd is visible, but on my agama wallet only the kmd that I had from before is visible. Tried to close and open the wallet. How comes?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Rudolf Nansen are you using the latest version?
https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.5.7-4

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: Yes I am.

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: To me it looks like the wallet is online and working.

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: I encrypted my wallet yesterday using cli response: encryptwallet <passphrase>

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: but that should not stop incoming transactions.

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: If I look up my address the amount is correct using kmdexplorer.io, but the wallet is not.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@Rudolf Nansen if you are comfortable with cli,
do the following:

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
check what block you are in. use `getinfo`
once you found the block number, e.g: for block 1444008 use `getblockhash 1444008`
once you have the hash for the block you are stuck at, use `invalidateblock <BLOCKHASH>` without <> like the command below
once that is done, use `reconsiderblock 035ee329fe10944f1b0bf659a8b8d2424322b98532deba0fe225f26eb350fdb2`

[11:48 AM] SHossain: wait for the daemon to get on mainchain which might take some time

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: Pinned a message.

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: I am not comfortable with cli no

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
you said:
```
I encrypted my wallet yesterday using cli response: encryptwallet <passphrase>
```

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: Using a guide that I found on the internet yes.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: the above steps are very similar, you can ask here if you can't proceed after a step

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: I will try

Author: Rudolf Nansen#0199
Content: Nice, that worked. Thank you so much @gcharang
